item.description:
We will be taking Ted's Trail (in Greenfield NH) to the summit of North Pack Monadnock, a round-trip 6 miles with ~1400' elevation gain, with an option to take Carolyn's Trail for the return for a loop hike. There should be sufficient water along the trail for the dogs. Pace will be relaxed for an easy/moderate hike, with plenty of stops for water, snacks, and general play. Your dogs may be on- or off-leash - your choice. Hike will be held rain or shine.

We will be meeting at the Lyndeborough Town Library at 10am and then heading over to the trailhead together. Please be on-time, as there is a limit on how long we will wait for latecomers.

Details can be found here:

Mountain:
http://www.peakbagger...

Trails:
http://www.hikeneweng...

Directions:
http://nhmountainhiki...

Bring:
- For you: 2+ quarts of water, lunch, some snack items, a windbreaker or sweatshirt in case it's windy at the summit, and a camera if you wish. Hiking boots are recommended, but comfortable (and dirt-friendly) sneakers work as well.
- For your dog(s): Leash, dog food snack

Contact:
Please email me - I'm happy to answer any questions!
item.name: NE Trail Dogs Hike to North Pack Monadnock
